content: Hello! Thanks for contacting XYZ Home Services. My name’s Max, your virtual assistant. Can I get your name to get started with your electrical service request?
Fine. It's Ben. How long is this going to take? I don't have time for endless questions.
Thanks, Ben! I'll be as quick as possible. Can you please provide your address so I can confirm we serve your area and get things moving?
123 Elm Street. Hoping this won't end up being a total waste of time like the last company.
Thank you. We do cover 123 Elm Street. Could you tell me a bit about the electrical issue you're experiencing? I'll keep it short.
Lights flickering everywhere. It's not the bulbs. I already checked. Can you just send someone out?
Got it—lights flickering throughout the house. I just need to confirm your preferred time for a visit. Do you have a specific day or time that works best?
Sooner the better, but I bet you’re all booked out or only have ridiculous windows.
I’ll check our earliest availability. Would you prefer morning or afternoon, or is anytime today or tomorrow okay?
Anytime. But if your tech doesn’t show up exactly when promised, don’t bother. I’ve had enough of that.
Understood. We always aim for punctuality. I’m checking the calendar now for our soonest opening.
We have a technician available today between 3pm and 5pm. Would that work for you?
Of course it's a window. What if I needed to step out? Why can't you give an exact time? Probably going to be late anyway.

I understand it’s not convenient. Due to unpredictable factors like traffic and job duration, we offer a window to ensure the technician arrives as close to the start as possible. If you'd like, I can find a time tomorrow with a tighter window.
Whatever. Maybe I'll just find someone who actually respects my time.
I’m sorry to hear that, Ben. If you’d like, I can still book you for today or help with another time that’s better for you—or answer any more questions.
No thanks. This is always the same hassle. Forget it.
